name: Scott Pearson
text: Receiving personnel were fast and friendly. Push intercom at gate. Enter man door by dock #6. Tolls to get there at this time from exit 68 are $1.50/$4.50 (car/18 wheeler) in each direction and they do accept credit cards for payment. There is a convenience store on the way from the interstate.

name: kevin johnson
text: Someone has managed to hide the bad reviews from me

text: My husband said super nice people..really fast to load he wants me to give 10 stars🥴

name: Roman Chernov
text: Easy place to get in and out. Docking is a bit tight if there is other trucks pressent. Had to change location of the marker. Originally wasn't placed correctly.  Address how ever is incorrect it will take you to businesses next door.

name: Diriyetrucking Inc
text: Truck was loaded within 15 minutes.  Good shipper.

name: Ed Bivens
text: Sometimes loads are not ready, but live loads go quick.

name: Lisa Hussey
text: I work here

name: Johnny Stephenson
text: Great people.They get you in & out in a hurry.

name: Billy
text: Fabulous!

name: Matthew Angry
text: Dropped the truck off at 0800 Monday for a mid roof conversion and it was done by 1500 Tuesday. Very quick turnaround, very polite staff, owner is a stand up guy and isn’t scared to talk to customers. Great quality work. Will be back for some fenders in the near future.

name: Travis & Tiffany Fly
text: Everyone has been awesome!  Friendly and helpful.  Highly recommended.

name: Ed Mcclendon
text: Tony ,Eric , Billy great experience an job well done ! Look's great . Thank You     /   Fender's holding up great , Thanks again Tony !! Finally got my front fenders on Tony ! They worked out great an look good too ! Appreciate you guys again ! Great products ! Easy to work with ! 👍👍🇺🇸

name: Meghan Lindsey Bubba
text: Absolutely love this company and the level of service ,integrity and attention to detail the whole staff puts into their work.  It is undeniably second to none! I highly recommend this company and crew to anyone looking to get the highest quality accessories and services on their next upgrades!  Keep up the Great work Tony, Mike, Tammy, Jeremy, Billy, Erik, Jeremy and a special thanks to the rest of the crew behind the scenes.

name: Rylee
text: Do not use the painter they use. The paint is very thin and after two weeks of driving the paint was flaking off. They don’t stand behind their painting and told me they couldn’t fix it when I talked to someone else who had the exact same thing happen. Fiberglass is great quality, but paint job was not.

name: William Hankins
text:
Great company with great products, we will be buying from again👍😎
KEEP ON TRUCKIN' TEAM

name: gaius thompson
text: These guys are so genuinely nice. I had an ugly truck but the motor was too good to retire. I only ran at night to avoid the DOT. I spent $1700 dollars and now people take pics of my truck regularly.

name: James Kimble
text: Great place very polite and professional staff very pleased with the work they did. Thanks very much. Will definitely tell others about them.

name: Roger Gilliam
text: They shipped me another set to replace the ones that were damaged. The new set fit great and turned out wonderful!! Thank you for your quick response!!!!

name: Custom Transport
text: Good people to work with.  Boys at th shop wer very helpful.

name: David Walden
text: Very friendly and helpful, had a small problem with the paint but was fixed very fast.

name: joe smoe
text: I purchased and had single low cut rear fenders installed on my 9900i and Tony and Eric are a class act. I will be sending folks your way..thank you..Bo

name: James Shepard
text:
Thank you. Mike, earache & install guys. Fantasick work. Also since all the "stars&moon pies have alligned, I'm going to my first & favorite nascar track race.
TALLADAGA !!!! I thank you.

name: thomas franks
text: Great People! Great Products!

name: Bobby Williams
text: Good

name: Robert McDill
text:
Buyer beware!!! I bought rear bumper fillers for a 74 Granville from this company 05/20/2020 the first order they sent me was for a Catalina which they said I order wrong... but because I'm in the parts business I know mistakes can happened... So I sent them back and they sent me what I ordered the first time, the trouble is they don't fit, they're 5/8" to short to mount up to the quarter panel.
I been messing around with this company for over a year if they would just sell a good product that fits I wouldn't be writing this review...
Jenny you seem like a nice person but you have to do better.

name: Robert Cashin
text: Their reviews speak volumes. They deliver horrible parts that don't even fit. Claiming oem specs, hanging up on you and threatening to sue you when you contact the BBB. Probably one of the most miserable receptionist on the planet also. Stay away. There's other, much more reputable places to deal with. My filler panels for my chevy are still sitting on a shelf. There's nothing I can do with them. They aren't even the correct dimensions.

name: Andrew Norgren
text:
It's been one year since I bought parts for my 1980 Malibu and I still am bothered with how terrible these parts were made and do not fit. Nothing is symmetrical, one corner bumper filler does not match the radius of the other filler. The long rear center filler looks like a it was made by a kid practicing in high school. Not straight or flat. Parts are pictured with holes drilled and ready to go on the website,, they are not, you will have to figure that out yourself. I emailed them and they sent out new parts, but they required A LOT of effort and time to make them work, but they still don't look right. The fact I paid nearly 500 dollars for parts that look like an amateur made them just infuriates me to my core.

If you want to save yourself a headache and countless hours or fitting and body work, try to find these parts anywhere else. I feel scammed, and I can send pictures to whoever would like to see them.

name: Knights of the Roundtable
text: Ordered my parts on April 8th 2021. I contacted them 3 times in regards to my order. One phone call I received, the associate seemed frustrated that I called. Finally after 3 months I received the wrong items.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize, both for the delays in production and the confusion with the order.  Like many small businesses, we have not been able to find additional fabricators that we have desperately needed (creating the production backlogs like we have never experienced in the history of our company).  While we have finally started to find people looking to work, all are green to our industry so there has also been a significant amount of training going on.  Packing the incorrect parts, while I’m sure an honest mistake, is still very frustrating I understand.  We are happy to correct this ASAP this coming week.  Please email me a number to contact you (sales@replica-plastics.com) and we will make this right!  Again we apologize and look forward to getting you fixed up for your restoration project.

name: mpuone
text:
Pros: Parts arrived and fit correctly.
Cons: Apparently their checkout doesn't account for international shipping, as several months later I received an invoice from Fedex for an additional $72. Replica Plastics has not responded to my emails.

resp.text: We apologize for any confusion on the international shipments; and the terribly long delay in this response. I am just seeing your (and others) reviews.  Unfortunately we aren’t responsible for the varying international duties on the packages sent to many different countries, but would be interested to see your emails to better understand the lagging cost from FedEx… would you mind resending the emails previously sent (jenny@replica-plastics.com)?  And thank you for the “Pros” comment, we appreciate your business!

name: Bryan Worley
text:
I ordered parts from this outfit on 10/8/20. Their stated time to get them in my hands was 45-60 days per the initial email confirming receipt of order and my funds.
It is now 12/17/2020, and I have not received parts, nor any sort of communication regarding my purchase. I have emailed twice, and called several times, although I never get a reply.

I am going to assume that I have been defrauded and contact my credit union.

resp.text: Hi Bryan, we sincerely apologize for the delay... both in response and in the shipment of your parts. This has truly been an unprecedented year and while we have worked diligently to increase production we are working from a backlog like we’ve never experienced. Not to mention half of our production staff out with COVID since Thanksgiving. I have shifted several fabricators from other departments and even our shop manager is assisting in our automotive area most days.  I know that orders around the date of your order began shipping this week so I would imagine that your order will be going out very soon if it has not already. I am the new owner of the business; I have provided my cell number in a DM and will be happy to check with production as to the status. Again I am sincerely sorry, this is NOT our standard operating procedures and look forward to the day that we are back to having parts in stock and ready to ship same/next day!

name: John Kachelmeyer
text:
I ordered four pieces for two different cars from Replica Plastics. Before attempting installation, I noticed one of the bumper fillers for the Caprice was misshapen to the point of being unusable. When calling about this this I was told that I could send it back if I wanted but that 'other people made them work '. I also ordered two fender extensions for my Oldsmobile 98, which at least appeared to be correct. Before attempting to install these, of course I had to spend time and money painting them. When I attempted to install them, it quickly became evident that would not fit on the car. I spent most of one day trying to modify one of the pieces, which was not easy since they're fiberglass. After still not being able to get the piece to fit, I decided to send them back. I emailed the company detailing my problem, and my extreme dissatisfaction with the product, and asking for a full refund. I received no response to this email. I also included a note to the same effect with the materials I was returning, which according to USPS tracking they received Monday October 21. As of this review (November 7) I have not had any refund or communication from the company. I have also filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau, but have made no headway there, either.

UPDATE: after contacting the Alabama AG’s office, I was contacted by a company representative and was issued a full refund.

name: Jerome Webb
text: Warning to all 1986 -1990 Caprice owners don't buy the bumper fillers from this place it's a waste of time and money. They will not fit the part is not wide enough and it will not lay flat on the top of the bumper.very low quality part.

name: Tibor Vanek
text: Friendly staff. PU apt at noon, arrived 10,30, out at 11,30. They have a scale. You need to have 2 straps, if you don’t, they can sell you 2 for$50.

name: LION
text: Nice people and friendly,quickly loaded... 5 stars

name: Ivelin Enchev
text:
Avoid !!! Avoid !!! Avoid !!!
We called over the phone they set the load was ready for pick up,showed up they set the load has to be tested in the lab,it's gonna be 3 hrs. Been sitting here for 6 hrs and finally  got loaded,now THANKS to them I'm out of hours,can't move,my day is gone . I'm not the only one,read the other reviews,it's daily thing !!!

text: Got me on the scale and door at 7am sharp. Started unloading as soon as I was docked on the door. Quick and easy.

text: This place is basically a family operation! It started out ok but then the plant managers son started to show who he really was! You take a 25 year old who started out mowing grass and put him in charge of grown people that's been there for years, it's a joke! Don't waste your time ! Oh and if you are a person of color, watch out because the 25 year old has a thing for not liking black people and this is coming from a white woman

name: Brian Pair
text: Worked there for almost 20 yrs. Lots of blood, sweat and a few tears shed there. Sad to see it's closing down. I made many great friends there and some are like family. My heart goes out to them.

text: Friendly staff. But why has everyone been on lunch for 2 hours now? Yet you can hear everyone in the warehouse laugh and clowning around. You might not have anything to do after you get a truck loaded but we do. Slow and long breaks. Let’s see how fast they can unload me.

text: I had a good experience here. I was picking up a load that was dropped by another carrier, so I was already arriving after the appointment time. They took me in and had me loaded in about 1.5 hours. Anything under 2 hours is good in this industry.

text:
This is one of the most best places to get loaded, I do not talk about one experience I talk about more than 300 loads I take from this place.
They are profesional, friendly and fast workers, always is been a pleasure take loads from you. Thanks and please never change. Fermar Transport

name: jose hernandez
text: After reading the only two comments that were there, I decided to give my experience. My appointment was schedule at 8:00. I arrived at receiver at 07:50 and at 8am they had already given me a dock. It was a 43,000 weight unload and at 9:15 am I was already empty. One hour and fifteen minutes is not bad. They were pretty fast. Thank you .

text: Slower than molasses. 5 hours to get 15 skids on. Nice people, but a pain in the ass.

name: George Daniel
text: Worked here 10 years and fired for no reason.

name: michael brunk
text: Checked in and the receiving clerk asked me my info I told him my pick-up number,my company name,and what broker I was picking up for. I was then told the system was down and go to truck and wait. I got in truck and proceeded to wait when low and behold the GOON SQUAD pulls up in a smoke grey Chevrolet with Alabama  stuff all over it(no wonder they stay mad) and tell me I had a attitude problem when checking in. I THINK the big hairy brut was either trying to intimidate or threaten me by saying he has to protect the office clerk/ forklift driver..HELL he's a got his big boy pants on let him come to me and say I had an attitude...now that in turn really broke out the ATTITUDE problem. I tried to get the guys name but every one here apparently don't know either for when I asked the clerk his name he said he didn't have one. On my defense I got the drivers name and number and one of forklift drivers name which is Frank stating I gave no attitude upon arrival/check in.

name: andrew newberry
text: In and out plus parking overnight the staff was very friendly second shift Great  people 💯🍰
